alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 03 at 1:45PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Wintry mix including potential freezing rain through Sunday morning... A low pressure system along the California and Oregon coast will bring a mix of snow, rain and possible freezing rain to northern Nevada. Snow is expected to begin this evening across Humboldt county. Snow levels will rise steadily through the evening and overnight hours causing a changeover from snow to a rain/snow mix across Humboldt county. Sheltered valleys that remain below freezing through the night may experience a brief period of freezing rain as well. Although there is only a slight chance for freezing rain, it does not take much to cause significant travel impacts. The most susceptible areas to freezing rain impacts will be bridges and overpasses as they tend to drop below freezing first. Precipitation will spread into Elko county overnight with a similar scenario of snow at the beginning then a changeover to a rain/snow mix as sunrise on Sunday approaches. Similarly low chances for freezing rain exists mainly in valley locations that remain below freezing. The threat of freezing rain diminishes after sunrise Sunday as road temperatures recover and air temperatures rise leaving behind a mix of rain and snow through Sunday afternoon. Snow amounts will generally be low at less than an inch in valley locations with snow levels rising to between 6500 and 7000 feet along I-80 by Sunday morning although northern Elko County and western Humboldt county could see up to two inches through Sunday night. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
